column4: does anyone know a good howto/tutorial for encrypting a livecd (bootable linux cd)?
you can't encrypt the entire CD
no, but I should be able to encrypt /etc, or other mount points
you can encrypt anything that is not required to get devmapper up and functional
come again: you can encrypt anything that is not required to get devmapper up and functional << don't fully understand you
dm-crypt is the correct way to encrypt filesystems. dm-crypt relies upon devmapper. so you can't have the stuff that enables devmapper on an encryted partition as it starts a chicken/egg problem.
no, OK, I need a small ection unencrypted, that I know
that's why I want a document on what to do - most of the docs I found are related to securing data on a PC, not on a CD
sorry, never cared about encrypting a CD. i don't see the point.
livecd with sensitive data (like vpnc.conf and wpa_supplicant.conf) - and because you don't see a reason, well, I do :)
they are hashed, but I just want my data encrypted on the CD
